channel.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
channel.description:
Ok, well. I just download this MoparScape 3.2. And, I have it opened. I clicked the "Start Server" thing, and then I logged in. I walked up to the bank, and then suddenly I got disconnected. Then everytime I try and get into it, it says,
"Error connecting to server. Must be down. Click "Cancel" then "Start Server" to make your own."
But if I shut down MoparScape, and then re-open it. Sometimes I can log back on for a few seconds before it shuts down again. I just updated my Java like some of the posts here said to do, but it still happens.
Oh, and the server is "127.0.0.1" if that means anything.
Thank you for any and all help. -Kai

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @Kerio Kerio
item.description:
@Kerio wrote:

Ah, alright. Yeah. I have that done. I can log in, but only for a extreamly short amount of time. It like, boots me after a few seconds on being on. So I did not think it would be the Firewall, seeing how if it was blocking it, I do not beleive I would be able to get on at all.

Read full topic
item.source: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Use the one that you forwarded with and the one you made in the ‘Exceptions’ tab in your firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @Kerio Kerio
item.description:
@Kerio wrote:

I would not mind playing alone for a bit on that server, but I have the little problem of it saying,

“Error connecting to server. Must be down. Click “Cancel” then “Start Server” to make your own.”

This is what I am trying to fix. Any ideas with the info I supplied? Or, do you need more info?

Read full topic

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @dmac-is-blak dmac-is-blak
item.description:
@dmac-is-blak wrote:

u can but y would u wanna e on aa server by urself …??? are u retarded or gay or someithng???

item.source: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Yes you can, it just means you’ll be playing alone, which isn’t bad, as if you’re checking to see if your commands work, etc. Yes, I guess when you put it like that, it can be expressed as ‘personal’

But if you want people to join your server and have access to it, you have to use the no-ip and port #. Good-Luck!

Read full topic
item.source: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @Kerio Kerio
item.description:
@Kerio wrote:

Uhm, Sorry, But I do not quite understand. I thought this one when it first starts it just like, a personal private server.

I cannot use the 127.0.0.1 for just playing around?

Read full topic
item.source: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

First of all, 127.0.0.1 is not your server IP, that’s a default i.p. Your no-ip address is the one you add and host from www.no-ip.com. Then it must be updated through DUC NO-IP , too.

Read full topic
item.source: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?

item.title: Sorry for asking.. but.. Connection Problems..?
item.dc:creator: @Kerio Kerio
item.description:
@Kerio wrote:

Alright, I opened the .bat file this time, and the DOS prompt stays up in the background, and when I try to log in, it just stays the black screen thing, with the “Connection Lost - Please wait, Attempting to Re-establish” or whatever it is. If I use the .bat it will just start up and do that, instead of just logging in for a few seconds before disconnecting.

Donno if this will help any or not, but yeah. I have been looking all over the forum and cannot find anything about my problem. So, if anyone can help, Much thanks.
-Kai

Read full topic
